values.description:
We are currently trying to approximate the use of a chroot on OS X by installing brew into isolated folders. This requires compiling many dependencies from source whose bottles are not relocatable.

I've tested sdformat with and without this branch:

* [without this branch: 4 min 24 sec](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/33/)
* [with this branch: 3 min 13 sec](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/32/)

I think the savings will be even larger for gazebo, which takes over 45 minutes compiling dependencies from source. The following gazebo build is using this branch and appears to be successful so far:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/199/
values.title: Use /usr/local for homebrew jenkins jobs

values.description: This first PRs will implement new jenkins job that will run the bitbucket set build status implementation, one will create the metadata file and the other set up the jenkins build status using that file.
values.title: Create bitbucket status jobs

values.description:
When python packages are needed for a homebrew jenkins build, it's easier to use the homebrew version of python since it includes pip. Also, the packages will be cleared with each new build.

As an example, sdformat uses the `psutil` package if available for memory leak testing. Testing with this branch shows that the `ElementMemoryLeak` test is now being run.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/SdformatDefault/job/sdformat-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/16/testReport/(root)/
values.title: Install pip packages on homebrew, for example psutil for sdformat

values.description:
A part from adding msgs to the list of supported ignition packages in the DSL some other actions in this PR:

 * Implemented `DOCKER_POSTINSTALL_HOOK` to allow installations of gem or pip packages or any other action inside the docker file generation.
 * Fix a bug on docker file generation closing if in a bad place.
 * Implement DSL option to avoid the test checking for packages that do not have tests (like ign-msgs)
values.title: Support ignition msgs

summary.raw:
A part from adding msgs to the list of supported ignition packages in the DSL some other actions in this PR:

 * Implemented `DOCKER_POSTINSTALL_HOOK` to allow installations of gem or pip packages or any other action inside the docker file generation.
 * Fix a bug on docker file generation closing if in a bad place.
 * Implement DSL option to avoid the test checking for packages that do not have tests (like ign-msgs)
summary.html:
A part from adding msgs to the list of supported ignition packages in the DSL some other actions in this PR:

  • Implemented DOCKER_POSTINSTALL_HOOK to allow installations of gem or pip packages or any other action inside the docker file generation.
  • Fix a bug on docker file generation closing if in a bad place.
  • Implement DSL option to avoid the test checking for packages that do not have tests (like ign-msgs)

values.description:
When a test fails repeatedly, [maven appends `<rerunFailure>` tags for each failure](https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/rerun-failing-tests.html), so let's do the same thing.

I also redacted some directory structure from example xml files (acc90a2) and created a `countFailures` function (2be7cf8).
values.title: flaky_junit_merge.py: add rerunFailure tags for repeated failures

summary.raw:
When a test fails repeatedly, [maven appends `<rerunFailure>` tags for each failure](https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/rerun-failing-tests.html), so let's do the same thing.

I also redacted some directory structure from example xml files (acc90a2) and created a `countFailures` function (2be7cf8).
summary.html:
When a test fails repeatedly, maven appends <rerunFailure> tags for each failure, so let's do the same thing.

I also redacted some directory structure from example xml files (acc90a2) and created a countFailures function (2be7cf8).

values.description:
## Summary

This PR adds a form of flaky test detection to the gazebo homebrew build (for gazebo7 and up, since older versions of gazebo have many failing tests) by re-running failed tests one time to see if they fail both times (issue #60). This makes use of the `--rerun-failed` argument to ctest, which requires cmake 3+. This is available on homebrew and vivid+ but not trusty by default.

When re-running the failed tests, the `test_results` folder needs to be shuffled and the new junit files merged with the previous version using the `flaky_junit_merge.py` script from previous pull requests. The information about flaky tests can be visualized with the jenkins flaky test plugin, which is already installed in jenkins and is enabled in the dsl with this pull request. [Here's an example of a build with flaky test information](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/%28root%29/). Unfortunately it doesn't display anything on the It doesn't display anything on the
[Test Results summary page](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/),
but if you click on
[(root)](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/%28root%29/)
it will show info about flaky tests.
Look for a storm cloud to see tests that didn't pass perfectly.

One concern about the flaky test plugin is that I have observed some jenkins failures in the gazebo test builds with this branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/282/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/284/

~~~
Recording test results
ERROR: Build step failed with exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:277)
	at com.google.jenkins.flakyTestHandler.junit.FlakyTestResult.<init>(FlakyTestResult.java:120)
~~~

I rebooted the machine and am watching to see if this failure recurs.

## Tests that fail to run

The `flaky_junit_merge.py` script was updated in pull request #214 to resolve #65.

One challenge with tests that fail to run is that `ctest --rerun-failed` won't re-run the `check_test_ran` script, so we wouldn't know if the test failed on the second try. There is a hack in  5aacd8d with `sed` and `grep` and a `make test` loop that is not pretty but is working.

Here are some example builds that show flaky versions of `test_ran` from [ign-math branch flaky_rand_test](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/flaky_rand_test%0Dign-math2#diff):

* In [run 62](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/62/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/) and [run 63](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/63/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/), the test completes one time and asserts one time. Thus [test_ran](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/63/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/test_ran/) is marked as a flaky pass. Note also that `test_ran` is listed in the same `RandTest` grouping since a matching `classname` is added in the flaky case.

* In [run 64](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/64/testReport/junit/%28root%29/Results/test_ran/), the test fails both times and is listed under the `Results` class as usual.
values.title: Rerun failed tests in gazebo homebrew (#60, #65)

summary.raw:
## Summary

This PR adds a form of flaky test detection to the gazebo homebrew build (for gazebo7 and up, since older versions of gazebo have many failing tests) by re-running failed tests one time to see if they fail both times (issue #60). This makes use of the `--rerun-failed` argument to ctest, which requires cmake 3+. This is available on homebrew and vivid+ but not trusty by default.

When re-running the failed tests, the `test_results` folder needs to be shuffled and the new junit files merged with the previous version using the `flaky_junit_merge.py` script from previous pull requests. The information about flaky tests can be visualized with the jenkins flaky test plugin, which is already installed in jenkins and is enabled in the dsl with this pull request. [Here's an example of a build with flaky test information](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/%28root%29/). Unfortunately it doesn't display anything on the It doesn't display anything on the
[Test Results summary page](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/),
but if you click on
[(root)](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/45/testReport/%28root%29/)
it will show info about flaky tests.
Look for a storm cloud to see tests that didn't pass perfectly.

One concern about the flaky test plugin is that I have observed some jenkins failures in the gazebo test builds with this branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/282/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/284/

~~~
Recording test results
ERROR: Build step failed with exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:277)
	at com.google.jenkins.flakyTestHandler.junit.FlakyTestResult.<init>(FlakyTestResult.java:120)
~~~

I rebooted the machine and am watching to see if this failure recurs.

## Tests that fail to run

The `flaky_junit_merge.py` script was updated in pull request #214 to resolve #65.

One challenge with tests that fail to run is that `ctest --rerun-failed` won't re-run the `check_test_ran` script, so we wouldn't know if the test failed on the second try. There is a hack in  5aacd8d with `sed` and `grep` and a `make test` loop that is not pretty but is working.

Here are some example builds that show flaky versions of `test_ran` from [ign-math branch flaky_rand_test](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/flaky_rand_test%0Dign-math2#diff):

* In [run 62](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/62/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/) and [run 63](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/63/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/), the test completes one time and asserts one time. Thus [test_ran](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/63/testReport/%28root%29/RandTest/test_ran/) is marked as a flaky pass. Note also that `test_ran` is listed in the same `RandTest` grouping since a matching `classname` is added in the flaky case.

* In [run 64](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/64/testReport/junit/%28root%29/Results/test_ran/), the test fails both times and is listed under the `Results` class as usual.
summary.html:
Summary

This PR adds a form of flaky test detection to the gazebo homebrew build (for gazebo7 and up, since older versions of gazebo have many failing tests) by re-running failed tests one time to see if they fail both times (issue #60). This makes use of the --rerun-failed argument to ctest, which requires cmake 3+. This is available on homebrew and vivid+ but not trusty by default.

When re-running the failed tests, the test_results folder needs to be shuffled and the new junit files merged with the previous version using the flaky_junit_merge.py script from previous pull requests. The information about flaky tests can be visualized with the jenkins flaky test plugin, which is already installed in jenkins and is enabled in the dsl with this pull request. Here's an example of a build with flaky test information. Unfortunately it doesn't display anything on the It doesn't display anything on the Test Results summary page, but if you click on (root) it will show info about flaky tests. Look for a storm cloud to see tests that didn't pass perfectly.

One concern about the flaky test plugin is that I have observed some jenkins failures in the gazebo test builds with this branch:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/282/
  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/284/
Recording test results
ERROR: Build step failed with exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:277)
    at com.google.jenkins.flakyTestHandler.junit.FlakyTestResult.<init>(FlakyTestResult.java:120)

I rebooted the machine and am watching to see if this failure recurs.

Tests that fail to run

The flaky_junit_merge.py script was updated in pull request #214 to resolve #65.

One challenge with tests that fail to run is that ctest --rerun-failed won't re-run the check_test_ran script, so we wouldn't know if the test failed on the second try. There is a hack in 5aacd8d with sed and grep and a make test loop that is not pretty but is working.

Here are some example builds that show flaky versions of test_ran from ign-math branch flaky_rand_test:

  • In run 62 and run 63, the test completes one time and asserts one time. Thus test_ran is marked as a flaky pass. Note also that test_ran is listed in the same RandTest grouping since a matching classname is added in the flaky case.

  • In run 64, the test fails both times and is listed under the Results class as usual.

values.description:
This PR allows to add to our build farm the debian collab-maint works needed for our maintained packages.

Also add peak-linux to supported packages.
values.title: Support for collab-maint debian repos: peak-linux

values.description:
Implement OSRFCIWorkflow class to handle the following orchestration:

   * set status in bitbucket: in progress
   * compilation
   * set status in bitbucket: ok if all went fine, failed if unstable or error

We will need to change our entry point from the bitbucket <-> jenkins daemon to point to this new x-ci-pr_any jobs, which will act as a the main CI job.

Future work:

   * Add windows and brew to the orchestration
   * Improve the information and links that arrives to bitbucket when something fail
   * Migrate ABI checking triggering to the orchestration
values.title: Implement orchestration for sdformat, gazebo and ignition

summary.raw:
Implement OSRFCIWorkflow class to handle the following orchestration:

   * set status in bitbucket: in progress
   * compilation
   * set status in bitbucket: ok if all went fine, failed if unstable or error

We will need to change our entry point from the bitbucket <-> jenkins daemon to point to this new x-ci-pr_any jobs, which will act as a the main CI job.

Future work:

   * Add windows and brew to the orchestration
   * Improve the information and links that arrives to bitbucket when something fail
   * Migrate ABI checking triggering to the orchestration
summary.html:
Implement OSRFCIWorkflow class to handle the following orchestration:

  • set status in bitbucket: in progress
  • compilation
  • set status in bitbucket: ok if all went fine, failed if unstable or error

We will need to change our entry point from the bitbucket <-> jenkins daemon to point to this new x-ci-pr_any jobs, which will act as a the main CI job.

Future work:

  • Add windows and brew to the orchestration
  • Improve the information and links that arrives to bitbucket when something fail
  • Migrate ABI checking triggering to the orchestration

values.description:
This is a standalone portion of pull request #209, which is about flaky test detection.

The `flaky_junit_merge.py` script has not been handling well the case when tests fail to run (#65). In this case, our `check_test_ran.py` script generates a junit file with different `testsuite` and `testcase` names, and also a root tag of `<testsuite>` instead of `<testsuites>`. This PR resolves that issue with more example xml files.

Also, the commits are atomic in case you want to read those in order.
values.title: Part of pull request #209: merge junit files from tests that failed to run (#65)

summary.raw:
This is a standalone portion of pull request #209, which is about flaky test detection.

The `flaky_junit_merge.py` script has not been handling well the case when tests fail to run (#65). In this case, our `check_test_ran.py` script generates a junit file with different `testsuite` and `testcase` names, and also a root tag of `<testsuite>` instead of `<testsuites>`. This PR resolves that issue with more example xml files.

Also, the commits are atomic in case you want to read those in order.
summary.html:
This is a standalone portion of pull request #209, which is about flaky test detection.

The flaky_junit_merge.py script has not been handling well the case when tests fail to run (#65). In this case, our check_test_ran.py script generates a junit file with different testsuite and testcase names, and also a root tag of <testsuite> instead of <testsuites>. This PR resolves that issue with more example xml files.

Also, the commits are atomic in case you want to read those in order.

values.description:
Different refactor actions:

 * Split all the configuration + compilation commands out of the `_generic_linux_compilation_build.sh.bash` and include options not to run test or cppcheck 
 * Add generic support to gazebo any job to build different dependencies.
 * Add the DSL to generate the multi-any job

The  [testing run with different branches](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any+sdformat_any+ign_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/34/console).
The [testing run of current gpu-none](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/306/console) for the jobs not defining the new variables.
values.title: Gazebo multi-any job

The  [testing run with different branches](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any+sdformat_any+ign_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/34/console).

values.description:
The DSL code added in pull request #209 didn't work to properly enable the Flaky Test Publisher plugin since it was used in a `configure` block. I don't know why that block was used, since I think the following will work.

Note that the `keepLongStdio false` statement is equivalent to omitting the `retainLongStdout()` function ([more info here](https://jenkinsci.github.io/job-dsl-plugin/#method/javaposse.jobdsl.dsl.helpers.publisher.PublisherContext.archiveJunit)), so this should have the same behavior
values.title: fix dsl code for flaky test publisher

summary.raw:
The DSL code added in pull request #209 didn't work to properly enable the Flaky Test Publisher plugin since it was used in a `configure` block. I don't know why that block was used, since I think the following will work.

Note that the `keepLongStdio false` statement is equivalent to omitting the `retainLongStdout()` function ([more info here](https://jenkinsci.github.io/job-dsl-plugin/#method/javaposse.jobdsl.dsl.helpers.publisher.PublisherContext.archiveJunit)), so this should have the same behavior
summary.html:
The DSL code added in pull request #209 didn't work to properly enable the Flaky Test Publisher plugin since it was used in a configure block. I don't know why that block was used, since I think the following will work.

Note that the keepLongStdio false statement is equivalent to omitting the retainLongStdout() function (more info here), so this should have the same behavior

values.description:
This is the first part of the improvements to CI information from jenkins to bitbucket.

1. Merge `_bitbucket_create_build_status_file.bash` and `_bitbucket_set_status.bash` into one job to be able to call it multiple times with differents URL and descriptions.

 * Testing the new set_status_job: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status_ng/4/
 * Testing the whole pipeline: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any/20/

Future pull request (to be sent):

2. Modify URLS sent to bitbucket. Change ci-pr_any by -ci-pr_any-$arch for inprogress and -ci-pr_any-$arch/$build_num for final result.

3. Add brew and windows jobs to the pipeline with the same scheme than in 2.
values.title: Merge orchestration create/set bitbucket

summary.raw:
This is the first part of the improvements to CI information from jenkins to bitbucket.

1. Merge `_bitbucket_create_build_status_file.bash` and `_bitbucket_set_status.bash` into one job to be able to call it multiple times with differents URL and descriptions.

 * Testing the new set_status_job: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status_ng/4/
 * Testing the whole pipeline: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any/20/

Future pull request (to be sent):

2. Modify URLS sent to bitbucket. Change ci-pr_any by -ci-pr_any-$arch for inprogress and -ci-pr_any-$arch/$build_num for final result.

3. Add brew and windows jobs to the pipeline with the same scheme than in 2.
summary.html:
This is the first part of the improvements to CI information from jenkins to bitbucket.

  1. Merge _bitbucket_create_build_status_file.bash and _bitbucket_set_status.bash into one job to be able to call it multiple times with differents URL and descriptions.
  • Testing the new set_status_job: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status_ng/4/
  • Testing the whole pipeline: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any/20/

Future pull request (to be sent):

  1. Modify URLS sent to bitbucket. Change ci-pr_any by -ci-pr_any-$arch for inprogress and -ci-pr_any-$arch/$build_num for final result.

  2. Add brew and windows jobs to the pipeline with the same scheme than in 2.

values.description:
Full support for CI for ignition-common software

The modification to the Windows generic job is risky, I run [a sdformat job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/75/console) to be sure that we are not breaking old jobs with the modification.

 * [DSL test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_ignition/188/)
 * [trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/4/)
 * [windows](build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/14)

values.description:
Create a directory `/srv/ccache` on the host and use it when running docker to shared compilation artifacts among the different builds.

The implementation includes a display of the statistics (ccache -s) before and after the compilation.

For the testing I've used sdformat:

  * First run was done with empty ccache dir
  * The green line is the one that measures compilation time
  * The variations of the red line are interesting but out of the scope of this PR
  * Note that the gain is permanent since the code base did not change from 1-6
  * Run 7 and 8 were done changing the source branch

The [resulting plot and the rest of the test information](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64_test_ccache_plot_3/plot/).
values.title: Support for CCACHE option on Linux (with docker)

values.description:
Two features in this PR:

 * Make the builds in the pull request to be marked as UNSTABLE when the package does not exits on brew. [test run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/71/)
 * Call bottle builder from PR updater after getting the PR_URL in a file from the shell execution and propagate it as a parameter in jenkins.

@scpeters any idea about what I can use to test this second case? A retry in an old build? I don't want to break anything :)
values.title: Connect brew PR updater with bottle builder

summary.raw:
Two features in this PR:

 * Make the builds in the pull request to be marked as UNSTABLE when the package does not exits on brew. [test run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/71/)
 * Call bottle builder from PR updater after getting the PR_URL in a file from the shell execution and propagate it as a parameter in jenkins.

@scpeters any idea about what I can use to test this second case? A retry in an old build? I don't want to break anything :)
summary.html:
Two features in this PR:

  • Make the builds in the pull request to be marked as UNSTABLE when the package does not exits on brew. test run
  • Call bottle builder from PR updater after getting the PR_URL in a file from the shell execution and propagate it as a parameter in jenkins.

@scpeters any idea about what I can use to test this second case? A retry in an old build? I don't want to break anything :)

values.description:
I just notice that pipelines items are sometimes running on our powerful building machines. This should change this and make them to run only on lightweight workers.

Note that this is not where the action (compilation) will be done, but where the pipeline job will be running.
values.title: Do not run pipeline items on lightweight nodes

values.description:
Looks like some of our machines are not able to run the [gazebo ABI checking](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/362/consoleFull) since it needs big amounts of RAM memory.

This PRs should change the nodes allowed to run the gazebo ABI to those marked as large-memory (optimus, r2d2)
values.title: Run gazebo ABI checker only on large memory machines

summary.raw:
Looks like some of our machines are not able to run the [gazebo ABI checking](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-vivid-amd64/362/consoleFull) since it needs big amounts of RAM memory.

This PRs should change the nodes allowed to run the gazebo ABI to those marked as large-memory (optimus, r2d2)
summary.html:
Looks like some of our machines are not able to run the gazebo ABI checking since it needs big amounts of RAM memory.

This PRs should change the nodes allowed to run the gazebo ABI to those marked as large-memory (optimus, r2d2)

values.description:
Part of the logic to keep backwards compatibility with previous exported directories that holds results (`build/*_results`) is buggy when there are more `*_results` directories in the build/ which are part of a given software. Let's limit the scope of find to run in the first level.

 * [Tested in opensplice build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/opensplice-debbuilder/25/)
 * [Tested in sdformat any](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/100/)
values.title: Limit the scope of look for _results directory

summary.raw:
Part of the logic to keep backwards compatibility with previous exported directories that holds results (`build/*_results`) is buggy when there are more `*_results` directories in the build/ which are part of a given software. Let's limit the scope of find to run in the first level.

 * [Tested in opensplice build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/opensplice-debbuilder/25/)
 * [Tested in sdformat any](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/100/)
summary.html:
Part of the logic to keep backwards compatibility with previous exported directories that holds results (build/*_results) is buggy when there are more *_results directories in the build/ which are part of a given software. Let's limit the scope of find to run in the first level.

  • Tested in opensplice build
  • Tested in sdformat any

values.description:
A Debian clean-up got player package (many open issues) some time ago, and although [I expressed](https://lists.debian.org/debian-science/2015/11/msg00015.html) my intention on trying to fix it the collective decision was to [take it out by that moment and I can reintroduce it later if all the issues are addressed](https://lists.debian.org/debian-science/2015/11/msg00024.html).

So there is no robot-player in debian now and it missed the Xenial sync. It is down in my list of things to work on, speak up if you feel like it would be a good contribution to the community.

This PR [was tested with the xenial gazebo](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-intel/8/console).
values.title: Player is not available on Xenial

summary.raw:
A Debian clean-up got player package (many open issues) some time ago, and although [I expressed](https://lists.debian.org/debian-science/2015/11/msg00015.html) my intention on trying to fix it the collective decision was to [take it out by that moment and I can reintroduce it later if all the issues are addressed](https://lists.debian.org/debian-science/2015/11/msg00024.html).

So there is no robot-player in debian now and it missed the Xenial sync. It is down in my list of things to work on, speak up if you feel like it would be a good contribution to the community.

This PR [was tested with the xenial gazebo](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-intel/8/console).
summary.html:
A Debian clean-up got player package (many open issues) some time ago, and although I expressed my intention on trying to fix it the collective decision was to take it out by that moment and I can reintroduce it later if all the issues are addressed.

So there is no robot-player in debian now and it missed the Xenial sync. It is down in my list of things to work on, speak up if you feel like it would be a good contribution to the community.

This PR was tested with the xenial gazebo.

values.description:
Hack to define xenial as reference platform for gpu-none.

I've changed the configuration in our daemon to link bitbucket PRs directly to the new job: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/

It still needs to be integrated into the whole pipeline but that change needs a refactor. I will use a new PR for it.

values.description: Only developers and requestors were mailed about failures. For standard software, that was enough for us to get the notifications but for jobs without a VCS history (like one-liner installations) no mails were sent.

values.description:
Implemented here:

 * DSL code to generate: `-ci-default`, `-ci-pr_any-` and workflow job
 * Generic OSRFLinuxNpm and OSRFLinuxNpmAny DSL jobs
 * docker based linux images to run testing

The testing consists of:

 * Install the latest nodejs from their own one line installation
 * run `npm install`
 * run `npm run build.dev` ([currently broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_bay-ci-xenial-amd64/4/console#console-section-5))
 * generate and export the .zip file

The integration with workflow works nicely to propagate status to bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-bay/commits/3bad08bf1f07f3435777de473cb8d1a73e02e835.

I also have enabled the auto-pr testing.
values.title: Support for ign-bay continuous integration

summary.raw:
Implemented here:

 * DSL code to generate: `-ci-default`, `-ci-pr_any-` and workflow job
 * Generic OSRFLinuxNpm and OSRFLinuxNpmAny DSL jobs
 * docker based linux images to run testing

The testing consists of:

 * Install the latest nodejs from their own one line installation
 * run `npm install`
 * run `npm run build.dev` ([currently broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_bay-ci-xenial-amd64/4/console#console-section-5))
 * generate and export the .zip file

The integration with workflow works nicely to propagate status to bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-bay/commits/3bad08bf1f07f3435777de473cb8d1a73e02e835.

I also have enabled the auto-pr testing.

  • Generic OSRFLinuxNpm and OSRFLinuxNpmAny DSL jobs

The integration with workflow works nicely to propagate status to bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-bay/commits/3bad08bf1f07f3435777de473cb8d1a73e02e835.

I also have enabled the auto-pr testing.

values.description:
I haven't tested any of this code, I'm just making a PR for discussion purposes. Currently the [homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/30/) is being triggered properly, but it isn't checking out the latest version of a branch before committing.

Also, there are multiple failed commands in that linked build, but the build proceeds normally. Is there a missing `set -e` somewhere?
values.title: Fix bottle hash updater

summary.raw:
I haven't tested any of this code, I'm just making a PR for discussion purposes. Currently the [homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/30/) is being triggered properly, but it isn't checking out the latest version of a branch before committing.

Also, there are multiple failed commands in that linked build, but the build proceeds normally. Is there a missing `set -e` somewhere?
summary.html:
I haven't tested any of this code, I'm just making a PR for discussion purposes. Currently the homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater job is being triggered properly, but it isn't checking out the latest version of a branch before committing.

Also, there are multiple failed commands in that linked build, but the build proceeds normally. Is there a missing set -e somewhere?

values.description:
This approach implements a jenkins job boolean parameter/env variable named `S3_UPLOAD_CANONICAL_PATH` used to modify the `S3_UPLOAD_PATH` to remove versioned/numbered paths (i.e: gazebo6 -> gazebo or gazebo6/releases -> gazebo/releases).

Needs testing.
values.title: Support for canonical names in uploads to S3

summary.raw:
This approach implements a jenkins job boolean parameter/env variable named `S3_UPLOAD_CANONICAL_PATH` used to modify the `S3_UPLOAD_PATH` to remove versioned/numbered paths (i.e: gazebo6 -> gazebo or gazebo6/releases -> gazebo/releases).

Needs testing.
summary.html:
